publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2611# Colin Fox: Our Prisons are not for Profit—That the Parliament believes that all of Scotland’s prisons belong in the public sector; supports the Prisons are not for Profit campaign, and believes that any partial-privatisation plans, such as the bridging the gap initiatives, undermine the prison service’s commitment to correctional excellence.

S2M-2611# Colin Fox: Our Prisons are not for Profit—That the Parliament believes that all of Scotland’s prisons belong in the public sector; supports the Prisons are not for Profit campaign, and believes that any partial-privatisation plans, such as the bridging the gap initiatives, undermine the prison service’s commitment to correctional excellence. Supported by: Rosie Kane*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Sandra White*, Frances Curran*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-2611 #Our Prisons are not for Profit (lodged on 17 March 2005) Alex Neil*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-2611 #Our Prisons are not for Profit (lodged on 17 March 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-2611 #Our Prisons are not for Profit (lodged on 17 March 2005) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2611# Our Prisons are not for Profit (lodged on 17 March 2005) Chris Ballance*
